application_type_full: Householder planning & demolition in a conservation area
description: Erection of a hip to gable roof extension, a rear roof dormer extension, excavation of basement and formation of a rear lightwell, erection of a two storey rear extension at basement and ground floor
decision_conditions: <p>The two storey rear extension, by reason of its height, depth, resulting scale and detailed design would result in a dominant and incongruous addition, causing harm to the character and appearance of the subject property and the Northwold and Cazenove Conservation Area. As such, the proposed development is contrary to policies D1 (London’s form, character and capacity for growth), D3 (Optimising site capacity through the design-led approach) and HC1 (Heritage conservation and growth) of the London Plan (2021), policies LP1 (Design Quality and Local Character) and LP3 (Designated Heritage Assets) of the Hackney Local Plan (2020) and the guidance contained within Hackney Residential Extensions and Alterations SPD 2009.<br></p>

<p>The proposed two storey rear extension at basement and ground floor levels, by reason of its depth, scale and siting, would result in loss of light and result in an increased sense of enclosure that would have an overbearing impact on the neighbouring occupiers at No.163 Osbaldeston Road to the detriment of their amenity. As such the proposed development is contrary to policies D1 (London’s form, character and capacity for growth) and D6 (Housing quality and standards) of the London Plan (2021), policy LP2 (Development and amenity) of the Hackney Local Plan (2020) and the guidance contained within Hackney Residential Extensions and Alterations SPD 2009.<br></p>

<p>The proposed hip to gable roof extension and rear roof dormer extension by reason of their scale, width, massing, detailed design and siting would result in incongruous additions that would result in unacceptable harm to the character and appearance of the subject property and the Northwold and Cazenove Conservation Area. As such, the proposed development is contrary to policies D1 (London’s form, character and capacity for growth), D3 (Optimising site capacity through the design-led approach) and HC1 (Heritage conservation and growth) of the London Plan (2021), policies LP1 (Design Quality and Local Character) and LP3 (Designated Heritage Assets) of the Hackney Local Plan (2020) and the guidance contained within Hackney Residential Extensions and Alterations SPD 2009.<br></p>
